text: We’re down to the wire & out meeting voters as we head toward Election Day tomorrow. Don’t forget to vote - at your polling place, at City Hall, or by postmarking your ballot by tomorrow.

I support a “right to housing,” but a right to housing doesn’t mean much if we don’t have enough homes. Some of the people advocating for a right to housing oppose efforts to expand housing. If we’re serious about people having homes, we have to allow those homes to be built.

Trans people in CA prisons are housed per their birth gender, not gender identity. That places them - esp trans women in men’s prisons - at great risk of violence. I’m authoring #SB132, requiring CA to let trans ppl to be housed per their gender identity.

Transitioning PG&E to a publicly owned utility - which I’m proposing in #SB917 - takes Wall Street out of the equation & allows this utility to focus on delivering safe, clean, reliable, affordable energy. Thank you UCLA @dailybruin for this great piece.

9/ Ending discrimination against straight people re domestic partnerships: I authored SB 30, to provide that all Californians, not just same sex couples, can choose to register as domestic partners instead of marrying.

4/ HIV prevention: I authored SB 159, a 1st-in-nation law expanding access to #PrEP & PEP by allowing pharmacists to prescribe them w/o physician Rx & banning insurance prior authorizations. Expanding access to these meds is key to ending HIV infections.

3/ Mental health & addiction: I authored SB 40, which expands & improves the new conservatorship law I authored last year. SB 40 will help us save the lives of people dying on our streets due to severe mental health & substance use disorders.

That’s existing law. *Existing* law provides that if a 15-17 year old has vaginal sex with someone up to 10 years older, the judge has discretion whether to put the person on the registry. If you disagree with the 10 year age difference, your disagreement is with existing law.
We’re simply saying it should all be discretionary the same as it is currently for vaginal sex. And it only applies if the minor is 15 or older.

Right now, if a 19 year old has vaginal intercourse with a 16 year old, the judge has discretion whether or not to put him on the registry. However if he receives oral sex from the 16 year old, the judge is mandated to put him on the registry. That’s irrational & discriminatory.

All the bill does is treat all forms of intercourse the exact same way vaginal intercourse is currently treated. We are not creating a new structure, just saying all forms of intercourse should be treated the same.
